alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Dawes; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Box Butte, eastern Morrill and southeastern Dawes Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92, or 21 miles south of Alliance, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alliance, Hemingford, Wild Horse Butte, Alliance Airport, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92, Berea, Angora, Box Butte Dam and Broadwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
